intro: Oenothera biennis subsp. caeciarum, commonly known as the narrowleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces capsules containing numerous small, black seeds. It thrives in sandy or loamy soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed areas. Oenothera biennis subsp. caeciarum is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators.
